location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.377 of 1850 from Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter contains a report on the seizure of an Oman town [Hoikaim] by Syed Ghes of Suhar. Hennell expects further hostilities from Said Ghes against Muscat territories with the close of the date-farming and pearl-fishing seasons.
